Hi Everyone,
I'm reaching out for some assistance with the HubSpot Site Search API.
*Issue:*
I've created a HubSpot private app and granted it all the necessary access levels. However, when I try to use the API for site search, I'm consistently receiving an HTTP 400 error. This issue persists even after attempting various API keys.
*Resources:*
• HubSpot Search Site Documentation: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/site-search>
• Error Screenshot: <https://imgur.com/YT1ARyj>
*Request:*
I would greatly appreciate any insights or troubleshooting tips you might have to resolve this HTTP 400 error and ensure proper functionality of the Site Search API.
Thanks in advance for your help.

:wave: Hi ya,

Wanted to know if anyone has developed come across a solution for updating line items  associated to deals in a given pipeline and stage.

For context: Developing a renewal management solution which auto creates the new deal. However, Line Items will not be cloned over given workflows can't govern the line item object. Left with having to develop a poller and applying a function to increase the price of certain line items by X%.

Original Deal ID is present in the new renewal deal, therefore can use that as the middle jumping point to join the original deal and from there retrieve the associated line items.

Writing it seems easier than coding the logic if you know what I am saying.

Add the scope of `marketing-email`  to the private and try again.

Requirements

To use the marketing single send API, the following requirements must be met:
• You must have a _Marketing Hub Enterprise_ account.
• The <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps|private app> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-app|public app> you’re using to make API requests has been granted the `marketing-email` scope.
